datasetPresenter.description: Sequence and annotations provided by Patrick Keeling and Jean-Francois Pombert at the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research, Evolutionary Biology Program, Department of Botany, University of British Columbia.

datasetPresenter.displayName: E. cuniculi Ec3 genome sequence from the Broad
datasetPresenter.description: E. cuniculi EC3, whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C and obtained from GenBank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/63207).

datasetPresenter.displayName: E. cuniculi Ec2 genome sequence from the Broad
datasetPresenter.description: E. cuniculi EC2, whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C and obtained from GenBank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/63205).

Microsporidia species originally isolated from wild-caught C. briggsae in Periyar Natural Preserve in Kerala, India (nematodes isolated by Marie-Anne Felix, microsporidia identified by Emily R. Troemel, see Troemel et al 2008). ERTm2 propagated in C. elegans N2 to generate genomic DNA, which was isolated by Emily R. Troemel (at the University of California-San Diego). Whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C as part of the Microsporidian Genomes Consortium, white paper written by Christina A. Cuomo and Emily R. Troemel. (http://www.broadinstitute.org/annotation/genome/microsporidia_comparative/MultiHome.html, http://www.broadinstitute.org/files/shared/genomebio/Microsporidia_wp.pdf).
Genome annotation was aided by RNA-seq analysis of N. parisii ERTm1: RNA isolated by Malina A. Bakowski (University of California, San Diego) and RNA-seq performed at the Broad Institute. Work at UC-San Diego supported by NIH R01 AI087528 to E.R.T. Genome analysis by Christina A. Cuomo, Christopher A. Desjardins, Malina A. Bakowski, Emily R. Troemel (see Cuomo et al, 2012).

Cuomo et al. describes genome sequence assembly, annotation and analysis.
Troemel et al. isolation of four Nematocida strains (ERTm1, ERTm2, ERTm3, ERTm4) and characterization of life cycle of N. parisii ERTm1 strain.

Microsporidia species originally isolated from wild-caught C. elegans in rotting apple in park in Santeuil, France (nematodes isolated by Marie-Anne Felix, microsporidia identified by Emily R. Troemel, see Troemel et al 2008). ERTm3 propagated in C. elegans N2 to generate genomic DNA, which was isolated by Emily R. Troemel (at the University of California-San Diego). Whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C as part of the Microsporidian Genomes Consortium, white paper written by Christina A. Cuomo and Emily R. Troemel. (http://www.broadinstitute.org/annotation/genome/microsporidia_comparative/MultiHome.html, http://www.broadinstitute.org/files/shared/genomebio/Microsporidia_wp.pdf)
Genome annotation was aided by RNA-seq analysis of N. parisii ERTm1: RNA isolated by Malina A. Bakowski (University of California, San Diego) and RNA-seq performed at the Broad Institute. Work at UC-San Diego supported by NIH R01 AI087528 to E.R.T.
Genome analysis by Christina A. Cuomo, Christopher A. Desjardins, Malina A. Bakowski, Emily R. Troemel (see Cuomo et al, 2012).

Cuomo et al. describes genome sequence assembly, annotation and analysis.
Troemel et al. isolation of four Nematocida strains (ERTm1, ERTm2, ERTm3, ERTm4) and characterization of life cycle of N. parisii ERTm1 strain.
Sequence and annotations from Genbank for E. bieneusi H348 contigs.

datasetPresenter.displayName: E. cuniculi Ec1 genome sequence from the Broad
datasetPresenter.description: E. cuniculi EC1, whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C and obtained from GenBank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/63135).

Microsporidia species originally isolated from wild-caught C. elegans in compost pit in Franconville, near Paris, France (nematodes isolated by Antoine Barriere and Marie-Anne Felix, microsporidia identified by Emily R. Troemel, see Troemel et al 2008). ERTm1 propagated in C. elegans N2 to generate genomic DNA, which was isolated by Emily R. Troemel (at the University of California-San Diego). Whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C as part of the Microsporidian Genomes Consortium, white paper written by Christina A. Cuomo and Emily R. Troemel. (http://www.broadinstitute.org/annotation/genome/microsporidia_comparative/MultiHome.html, http://www.broadinstitute.org/files/shared/genomebio/Microsporidia_wp.pdf).
Genome annotation was aided by RNA-seq analysis of N. parisii ERTm1: RNA isolated by Malina A. Bakowski (University of California, San Diego) and RNA-seq performed at the Broad Institute. Work at UC-San Diego supported by NIH R01 AI087528 to E.R.T.
Genome analysis by Christina A. Cuomo, Christopher A. Desjardins, Malina A. Bakowski, Emily R. Troemel (see Cuomo et al, 2012).

Cuomo et al. describes genome sequence assembly, annotation and analysis.
Troemel et al. isolation of four Nematocida strains (ERTm1, ERTm2, ERTm3, ERTm4) and characterization of life cycle of N. parisii ERTm1 strain.
Genome Sequence for E. hellem ATCC 50504 strain for downloaded from Genbank (GenomeProject ID #53973). Sequence provided by University of British Columbia.

Sequence and annotations from Patrick Keeling at Canadian Institute for Advanced Research, Evolutionary Biology Program, Department of Botany, University of British Columbia for Encephalitozoon intestinalis chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format.

datasetPresenter.displayName: E. cuniculi GB-M1 chromosomes sequence and annotation
datasetPresenter.description: Sequence and annotations from BioHealthBase for E. cuniculi GB-M1 chromosomes in Genbank (sequence and annotated features) format.
WGS assembly for N. ceranae BRL01 was described by Cornman RS et. al. and downloaded from Genbank ( N.ceranae Genbank Record)
